body_html:
By the way, one suggestion I would have for the documentation of get_next is emphasize that calling the resulting op repeatedly is going to return sequential batches of data. From the documentation at [1] and from most iterator interfaces (java, c++), the convention assumes that you would have to call get_next to fetch a new batch.

[1] https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_docs/python/tf/data/Iterator#get_next
body_text:
By the way, one suggestion I would have for the documentation of get_next is emphasize that calling the resulting op repeatedly is going to return sequential batches of data. From the documentation at [1] and from most iterator interfaces (java, c++), the convention assumes that you would have to call get_next to fetch a new batch.
[1] https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_docs/python/tf/data/Iterator#get_next
body:
By the way, one suggestion I would have for the documentation of `get_next` is emphasize that calling the resulting op repeatedly is going to return sequential batches of data. From the documentation at [1] and from most iterator interfaces (java, c++), the convention assumes that you would have to call `get_next` to fetch a new batch.

[1] https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_docs/python/tf/data/Iterator#get_next
